meanings.definition: To speak louder or more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, Sarah outspeaks her opponent with confidence.
meanings.sent2: The teacher outspeaks the students to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The parrot outspeaks the other birds in the pet store, amusing the customers.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the topic outspeaks any doubts others may have about her knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The powerful voice of the singer outspeaks the noise of the crowd, capturing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To surpass in speaking ability or eloquence.
meanings.sent1: In the poetry competition, Emily outspeaks all her classmates with her beautiful verses.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker outspeaks his peers with his inspiring words.
meanings.sent3: The comedian outspeaks the audience's expectations with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her eloquence outspeaks any language barrier, touching the hearts of people from different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder outspeaks the younger generation with his profound wisdom and experience.
